solution_line_template: In inches, the height of the rim is {rim_height_feet}*{inches_per_foot} = <<{rim_height_feet}*{inches_per_foot}={rim_height_inches}>>{rim_height_inches} inches.

Thus, the height that the player needs to be able to reach is {rim_height_inches} + {inches_above_rim_needed} = <<{rim_height_inches}+{inches_above_rim_needed}={total_reach_needed}>>{total_reach_needed} inches.

Without jumping, the player can reach their height plus an additional {reach_above_head} inches, or a total of {player_height_feet}*{inches_per_foot} + {reach_above_head} = <<{player_height_feet}*{inches_per_foot}+{reach_above_head}={player_standing_reach}>>{player_standing_reach} inches.

Therefore, the player needs to jump {total_reach_needed} - {player_standing_reach} = <<{total_reach_needed}-{player_standing_reach}={jump_height_needed}>>{jump_height_needed} inches to reach the height required to dunk a basketball.
